intro: Cryptantha salmonensis, commonly known as the salmon bladderflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Cryptantha salmonensis is often found in open, disturbed areas and is considered a perennial herb.
